Possible Cause: Operator error, e.g., shift handover. MV307 closed after maintenance
Consequence: Spoilt batch
Safeguard/Protection: Detected at sampling and can easily be corrected. Batch sheet requires analysis to be signed off by supervisor
Action: Start-up check to confirm that MV307 is open
Operating procedure to include a sight glass check that flow is established

Possible Cause: F2 not fully emptied from last batch
Consequence: Excess of B in product; batch will be out of specification
Safeguard/Protection: Detected at sampling but a special procedure will then be required
Action: Operating procedure to include a check on vessel F2 before B is measured out

Deviation: Too little of B is added
Possible Cause: Blockage in line or at OP1
Consequence: Batch out of specification and process delay
Safeguard/Protection: Detected at sampling
Action: Check procedure for clearing line and OP1 when transfer line holds component B
Batch sheet to require a check that F2 is empty at end of the addition stage

Deviation: Too much of A is present
Possible Cause: Error at earlier stage resulting in small excess (double charging covered in HAZOP of addition step)
Consequence: Batch out of specification and process delay
Safeguard/Protection: Detected at sampling
Action: Check that procedure will be written to cover this case and include in training program

Possible Cause: Error at earlier stage resulting in small deficiency
Consequence: Batch out of specification and process delay. Not easily corrected
Safeguard/Protection: Detected at sampling
Action: Evaluate likelihood of this deviation and, if necessary, draw up procedure

Possible Cause: Corrosion/erosion of OP1
Consequence: Reaction rate and heat release increased. May eventually exceed vessel cooling capacity leading to over-temperature
Safeguard/Protection: Independent alarms TICA 32/33 located in a manned control room
Action: Check that OP1 material is compatible with component B

Possible Cause: Wrong OP fitted at OP1 after maintenance
Consequence: Could quickly exceed the vessel cooling capacity, causing a reaction runaway and demand on BD2
Safeguard/Protection: TICA32/33 located in a manned control and BD2 relieving to dump tank. Good control of maintenance
Action: 7.1 Specify OP1 size in operating procedure and ensure problem is covered in operator training
7.2 Confirm flowrate at OP1 at the water trials stage
7.3 Control sequence to include trip closure of AV203 and fully open CV303 in the event of over-temperature

Possible Cause: MV306 is open and so orifice plate OP1 is bypassed
Consequence: Will very quickly exceed the vessel cooling capacity and lead to a reaction runaway and demand on BD2
Safeguard/Protection: TICA32/33 to manned control room and BD2 relief to dump tank. BD2 is sized for addition at maximum possible flow rate in a 25 mm line
Action: 8.1 MV306 to be locked closed as it is not used in this process
8.2 Include sensing of BD action to give alarm and to close AV203

8.3 Consider removal of OP2 from the cooling water inlet line so full cooling capacity will be available. Take into account the original purpose of OP2 in controlling heating rates/cooling profiles/blowdown of condensate

Possible Cause: Partial blockage in line or at orifice plate OP1
Consequence: Batch time extended
Safeguard/Protection: Operator will note problem when seeking to move to next stage
Action: Covered by actions 3.1 and 3.2

Possible Cause: Crack or leak at BD2 (action 8.2 only detects full burst)
Consequence: Loss of contaminated nitrogen to dump tank and eventually to atmosphere
Safeguard/Protection: None
Action: Put BD2 on a regular checking schedule

Possible Cause: Control problem or faulty temperature signal (reads low)
Consequence: Overheating will occur, with contributions from the heating system. Most serious condition would be common effect since both temperature probes are in the same pocket in F2
Safeguard/Protection: None unless the fault also leads to a low temperature alarm when operator intervention could be expected
Action: Check whether it is possible to physically separate the two temperature probes (control and protection) to reduce common cause effects

Possible Cause: Loss of cooling water (a low probability event)
Consequence: Overheating. Runaway if cooling water is not restored or the addition halted
Safeguard/Protection: TICA32/33 are located in the manned control room and BD2 relieves to dump tank
Action: Covered by action 7.3

Possible Cause: Jacket not switched from steam to cooling water after earlier step
Consequence: Overheating with possible reaction runaway
Safeguard/Protection: TICA32/33 to manned control room and BD2 relieves to dump tank
Action: Control program to include checks that valve CV301 on the steam line is closed

Possible Cause: Control problem or faulty temperature signal (reads high)
Consequence: Poor quality batch. Extreme outcome is cessation of reaction and accumulation of unreacted B
Safeguard/Protection: TAL from TICA 32
Action: 14.1 Take TAL from both the control and the protection temperature sensors
14.2 Determine suitable interval for calibration checks on TICs

Possible Cause: No causes identified in addition to the runaway situations discussed above
No additional causes found
Mechanical coupling fails or agitator blade becomes detached
Consequence: Risk of accumulation of unmixed B leading to uncontrolled reaction
Safeguard/Protection: Possibly detected by low motor current alarm
Action: Add a rotation sensor to the shaft of the stirrer; interlock to reactant feed valve AV203

Possible Cause: Motor failure
Consequence: Risk of accumulation of unmixed B leading to uncontrolled reaction
Safeguard/Protection: Alarm on motor current (low)
Action: 18.1 Existing safeguard adequate provided action 17.1 is implemented
18.2 Develop a safe operating procedure for restarting a batch after accumulation has occurred

Possible Cause: Viscous mixture formed
Consequence: Stirring becomes inefficient and unmixed B may accumulate
Safeguard/Protection: May be alarmed by sensor added in action 17.1
Action: Check viscosity under extreme conditions to decide if action is needed. If so, include an alarm on high motor current

Possible Cause: Incorrect connection after maintenance
Consequence: Stirring becomes inefficient and unmixed B may accumulate
Safeguard/Protection: None
Action: Include a check on stirrer operation in the commissioning trials and in the maintenance procedures

Possible Cause: Wrong ratio of reactants covered under high/low quantity
Wrong drum used when charging component B
Consequence: Unpredictable but minimum will be a spoilt batch
Safeguard/Protection: Covered in HAZOP of the charging step
Action: Review actions from earlier HAZOP and ensure that the purchasing department specifies a distinct drum color

Possible Cause: Complete loss of control computer
Consequence: System moves to fail safe condition
Safeguard/Protection: Design assumes a period of operation of the computer on its UPS. Ultimate protection is provided by BD2
Action: Check that fail safe settings include isolation of feed of B, continued stirring and full cooling to vessel jacket

Possible Cause: Selective failure. Most serious: loss of temperature sensors/control
Consequence: Possible undetected overheating
Safeguard/Protection: Ultimate protection is provided by BD2
Action: Check that the temperature sensors connect to different input boards
Include temperature comparison (TICA32/22) in the checks and add a difference alarm

Possible Cause: Step started early
Consequence: Starting temperature is low. Reactant may accumulate and then cause runaway reaction once mixing starts
Safeguard/Protection: Ultimate protection is provided by BD2
Action: Specify the lowest safe starting temperature
Provide software interlock to prevent low temperature start

Possible Cause: Workout period is shortened if the addition is slow (for any reason)
Consequence: Uncertain—basis for inclusion of the workout period is not clear
Action: Carry out further laboratory work to determine the importance of the workout and to define the minimum allowable time

Consequence: All valves move to assigned failure positions
Action: Review the failure modes of all valves to ensure specification is correct

Possible Cause: Unpredicted failure, cut cable, and so on
Consequence: Stirrer stops. Computer moves plant to a safe hold position
Safeguard/Protection: Computer has its own UPS
Action: Include this condition in the check under 27.1
Consider need for planned restart procedure after such an interruption

Possible Cause: Valve problem on AV203 during the transfer
Consequence: AV203 cannot be isolated from F2 for safe maintenance
Safeguard/Protection: None
Action: Put additional manual valves in the F2/F3 line
As a general action, review the P&ID to ensure all key items can be isolated

Possible Cause: Inspection or other requirement for entry to vessel
Consequence: Risk to operator from inert atmosphere, especially nitrogen
Safeguard/Protection: Spades installed on all lines
Action: Review the isolation of F3, including possible insertion of flexible section into the nitrogen line so it can be disconnected and blanked off. Need to cover F2 as well since it has its own nitrogen supply and is linked to F3

Possible Cause: Leaking flange on transfer line from F2 to F3
Consequence: Some loss of component B into process area
Safeguard/Protection: All spillages in this area run to a common sump
Action: Check the materials in use on adjacent units for potential incompatibility
Operating procedure to include a routine inspection of the transfer line at the stage of the process

Possible Cause: Imbalance in quantities of A or caustic added previously
Consequence: Batch quality affected unless initial pH is range 10—11.5
Safeguard/Protection: None
Action: Operating procedure to include a check on pH before this step is initiated
Consider need for a procedure for correction of pH

Possible Cause: Any
Consequence: Control system moves the plant to a predetermined state based on the trip signals
Action: Prepare matrix to show which valves act in each trip scenario. Review the matrix at next HAZOP meeting

Possible Cause: Leakage or spillage
Consequence: Contamination
Safeguard/Protection: Standard procedures
Action: Confirm that procedures exist for all materials handled in the process
